Well two is better than one!

Two is worse than one. New leechers do not know which to choose, instead of re-enforcing the cloud of the original, they split up, complete their downloads and disconnect. Since so many leechers do not fulfill their responsibility to seed, the chances of finding active torrents is made much lower when there are duplicates. At least when there is one torrent it can remain healthy through the overlapping comings and goings of the leech/seeders.

Duplicate software kills torrents, demonstrates disrespect for the original seeder and unnecessarily burdens the already staggering tracker system.

Always worse as now it means there will be two weak torrents as Opposed to 1 strong one!

DELETE!!!

There are statistically achieved understandings of how torrents survive and die. Opinions, favorites and personal preferences have no effect on those statistics; however, comments by TPB members demonstrate that users have a direct and uncaring  effect on the survival of the torrents.
